content: pattern basic knee high toe up sock https //singlestitchknit wordpress com/2012/06/28/basic-knee-high-toe-up-sock-pattern/ yarn knit picks felici self striping yarn 75% superwash merino wool 25% nylon 218 yards/50g #24401 aquarium 2 skeins needles size us 2 2 75 mm two 24 circular needles dpns or one 40 circular needle gauge 32 stitches and 40 row over 4 /10 cm finished us women s shoe size 7-8 measurements 14-15 calf circumference abbreviations k = knit p = purl sts = stitches co = cast on pm = place marker slip_stitch = slip_stitch purlwise m1l = make one left m1r = make one right ssk = slip slip knit k2tog = knit two together if using dpns divide stitches according e g 12/6/6 p2tog = purl two together for heel/instep/instep or 6/6/6/6 for heel = heel bottom of foot or back of leg sts heel/heel/instep/instep instep = instep top of foot or front leg sts round 1 k across all stitches toe round 2 using *judy s magic cast on co 24 sts 12 on each heel k1 m1l k to last heel stitch m1r k1 needle the first 12 stitches are for the heel and instep k1 m1l k to last instep stitch m1r k1 the second 12 stitches are for the instep repeat above two rounds until there 56 stitches knit across the heel stitches knit across the instep total 28 heel sts 28 instep sts stitches through the back loops as per judy s magic cast on fitting tip toe increases should stop as soon as the first four toes fitting tip are covered width wise the sock should not be wide increasing the number of cast on stitches will give a more enough to cover the pinky toe err on the side of too square toe while decreasing the number of cast on narrow vs too wide stitches will create a more pointed toe * = see technique links at end of pattern © 2012 single stitch knit all rights reserved page | 1 https //singlestitchknit wordpress com pattern basic knee high toe up sock https //singlestitchknit wordpress com/2012/06/28/basic-knee-high-toe-up-sock-pattern/ foot row 1 rs k25 pm k4 ssk k turn row 2 ws slip_stitch p9 p2tog p turn continue to knit all stitches until sock reaches the chart available for row 3-19 front of the ankle approx 40-45 rounds row 3 slip_stitch slip_stitch k 5 times ssk k turn row 4 slip_stitch p11 p2tog p turn fitting tip row 5 slip_stitch k slip_stitch 6 times ssk k turn the sock should be pulled up when checking to see if it s row 6 slip_stitch p13 p2tog p turn at the front of the ankle otherwise it will be too big if row 7 slip_stitch slip_stitch k 7 times ssk k turn you made too many toe increases you can compensate row 8 slip_stitch p15 p2tog p turn here by making the foot shorter row 9 slip_stitch k slip_stitch 8 times ssk k turn row 10 slip_stitch p17 p2tog p turn foot
